title: Filed chapter 13 in 2009. Converted to chapter 7 December 2010. Now I need to file chap 7 again. Has the 8 years ran for filing?
question: So does the original filing date in 2009 rule or is it when it converted in 2010. If it's 2010 then it hasn't been 8 years yet.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy means test,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Real estate and bankruptcy,Real estate
answers: You always calculate from the original filing date. conversion date does not matter. You can file now.

You are eligible to file again on the basis of 8 or more years having passed since your 13 you filed in 2009. You still have to pass the Means Test and there are other considerations involved before deciding on filing a Chapter 7 or 13.
